title: Great idea, poorly executed

content: Works poorly. I love the Bring! app on my phone. Use it regularly for shopping with the family so everyone can add things. I should just be able to say "Alexa, add milk to my list" without activating a skill EVERY time.But I could live with this, but the kicker, Bring! constantly gets it wrong.  Alexa understands my voice fairly well, but for some reason, Bring! gets the item wrong 6 out of 10 times.  I say something clearly, and she adds some obscure item.  If it is wrong, I have no way of removing and re-speaking it.  I ALWAYS end up opening the phone app to correct the misunderstandings, or to verify she understood.I really want this skill to work.  It is a great skill in theory, and I keep trying hoping it will improve, but after weeks and weeks of using it, I decided it was time to write a review.Bring! Labs.... PLEASE fix this!Make her talk less,Allow me to delete last entry.  If I say "delete" right after she repeats the entry, would be nice, because she is wrong SO often.Give option to read the list (even things added previously from the phone app)Provide some instructions.  I'm just guessing on this Alexa skill.  Need a "help" command.2 stars is being generous, only because I like the idea of this and hope it will get fixed.

title: Works perfectly!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2017
content: It’s been functioning great for me so far, no issues or complaints!  I love to simply be able to tell Alexa to add something to my list. Yes, it might be cool if you could add multiple items rather than one at a time, however, to me the main purpose of this is to be able to add items as you think of them/need them. I open the fridge and see I’m low on milk, “Alexa, add milk to my shopping list.”  Done!  Without grabbing my phone, it’s there. Then 10 minutes later I notice another item to add. Easy and simple. Sure it could be cool in certain scenarios where I do have a long list to add, in which case it could get tiring saying each item one at a time, but for the most part the ability to add things to your list with your voice is to avoid needing to sit down and think... “what are all the items I’m currently out of and need to pick up at the store....”. I don’t need to do this, because I slowly added them as they came to mind. And that to me is what makes this so awesome and functional for my life!  Even before I used Alexa, generally I was only adding one or two items at a time to my list, and this is what would be annoying. I’d grab my phone, add an item, minutes or so later I’d remember something else I need, back to my phone to write it down. Now I simply keep doing what I’m doing, tell Alexa and it’s done!
